website_summaries.verdict: If you only need to control three devices, the Logitech Harmony 200 is the best universal remote you can buy for under $20.
pros: The $20 Logitech Harmony 200 is a well-designed universal remote with great ergonomics
You program it via streamlined wizard-style setup software (Mac or PC) that's optimized for tech novices
cons: The Harmony 200 only controls three devices and requires a computer with Internet access to configure
For just $40 more, a step-up model adds an LCD screen and uses the activity-based commands that Harmony is known for

customer_reviews.title: This is a nightmare of logitech
customer_reviews.text: I owned recently a Harmony 300 remote which was just OK for 3-4 devices and its buttons were so well situated. Later I decided to go on for Harmony 200 as I was planning to use it only for TV+Set-Top box. Well, this is so drastically worse then Harmony 300 that I'd advise to keep away from this fiasco... WHY? The most "tortured" navigation key landscape (in contrast with H 300) is made of same (monolith) latex material and pressing any of five keys on its surface is same as playing in Vegas casino... good luck...
customer_reviews.author: TaG

customer_reviews.title: ... up for my old system and it was working great, I replaced 4 remotes with it by tricking ...
customer_reviews.text: I had this all set up for my old system and it was working great, I replaced 4 remotes with it by tricking it a bit. But when I changed a lot of my gear last year and needed to reprogram it, the weakness of having to log in to the company website to do this reared its ugly head - there was no trace of my account, so I just lost motivation to deal with it. Maybe someday I'll log in again as a new user and reprogram everything I did that hasn't changed again in order to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Huw Powell

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: I have used one of these for a long time with my parents. It works with an incredible amount of products, is fully customizable, and for the most part very easy to set up. I did find out that it has a very hard time working with my projector... While it is capable of learning buttons like power and volume it has a lot of difficulty with the other buttons such as the input button. Its a great product and does have learning ability but some things are to complicated for it to learn. I still would recommend it to anyone or its higher counterparts.
customer_reviews.author: Powers

customer_reviews.title: Great remote, hiccups programming
customer_reviews.text: The remote works great. Note that even though the buttons are labled "TV, Cable, and DVD", this will work for any three A/V devices (e.g. TV, stereo receiver, and Roku). I like Logitech's programming approach of building up from a library of device templates. However, I have sometimes had problems programming it with Logitech's tool, which is a Web site based on Microsoft Silverlight. I would feel better if there were also an open source implementation of a programming tool.
customer_reviews.author: tedhh

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few weeks to buy this because of the cost. I was afraid of getting burned. However, this older model remote worked perfectly with all the devices in the house... both new and old! It really helps to know what manufacturer and which make and model device you have. I had no issues with it. Installed the software, updated from their website, found the devices and programmed the remote. Works perfect on our Sony, Samsung, older AT&T U-Verse DVR, and Toshiba devices.
